body: WHEN word got out two years ago that a 400-bed homeless shelter was coming to the neighborhood, a shiver went through my building. The sentiment was unanimous and predictably dark. body: Marta Sofer sat in her mother's apartment in Brooklyn, spinning stories of her childhood, and of her mother, Rozsi Weisz.
